abstract: The name of the source file.
overview:
## Discussion

The name of the source file is derived from this instance’s [doc://org.swift.testing/documentation/Testing/SourceLocation/fileID] property. It consists of the substring of the file ID after the last forward-slash character (`"/"`.) For example, if the value of this instance’s [doc://org.swift.testing/documentation/Testing/SourceLocation/fileID] property is `"FoodTruck/WheelTests.swift"`, the file name is `"WheelTests.swift"`.

The structure of file IDs is described in the documentation for [https://developer.apple.com/documentation/swift/fileID()] in the Swift standard library.

# fileName

**Instance Property**

The name of the source file.

## Declaration

```swift
var fileName: String { get }
```

## Discussion

The name of the source file is derived from this instance’s [doc://org.swift.testing/documentation/Testing/SourceLocation/fileID] property. It consists of the substring of the file ID after the last forward-slash character (`"/"`.) For example, if the value of this instance’s [doc://org.swift.testing/documentation/Testing/SourceLocation/fileID] property is `"FoodTruck/WheelTests.swift"`, the file name is `"WheelTests.swift"`.

The structure of file IDs is described in the documentation for [https://developer.apple.com/documentation/swift/fileID()] in the Swift standard library.

## Related Documentation

- **fileID**: The file ID of the source file.
- **moduleName**: The name of the module containing the source file.
